data.title: Use player name as default for global chat
data.body: Sets the nickname for the global chat to the same as the player name by default. Closes #9728.

data.title: SHP(TD) LCW Decoder limitation
data.body:
I would humbly request this limitation be uplifted by porting the higher resolution algorithm support from VQA decoder also for SHP as SHP currently only support the 64kb at max basic encoding decode which is switched to the other LCW algorithm that uses relative offsets instead of absolute by null byte marker.
If null byte is encountered, switch to the other LCW decoder method just like VQA decoder does already in OpenRA.

Else SHP (TD) format is resolution limited somewhere above 256x256 at best :/ and what exceeds this, will also look ingame like the picture. Not asking for encoder here, just extended format read support.

![tdencoding](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16901747/12587018/403c582e-c45b-11e5-8756-8986c4fe96e9.png)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30226606-shp-td-lcw-decoder-limitation?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Enable Chrono Tank at "No Superweapons"
data.body: Enables Germany's Chrono Tank at "No Superweapons" by removing Chronosphere from prerequisites and lowering tech-level requirement to 'high'.

data.title: Where I can edit unit speeds on rock, sand, dunes etc?
data.body: And Where I can ask same questions?

data.title: Do You look into make Android support?
data.body: sorry for my very ugly Inglish again.

data.title: Fixed AppVeyor pull request artifact suffixes
data.body: `OpenRA-.exe` to `OpenRA-11455c8.exe` if everything goes right.

data.title: Fix TD aircraft being visible through fog.
data.body: The fog represents the lack of visibility, so seeing things move under it does not make sense (this is the same logic we use for the Carryalls in D2K).  This also looks glitchy, as the contrail rendering is disabled under the fog.

data.title: Fix button positions on TD connection dialog.
data.body:
"forward" acting buttons go on the right.
"back" acting buttons go on the left.

data.title: Fix spectator kick button in TD lobby.
Updated to SDL 2.0.4 for Windows
data.body:
Changelog: https://forums.libsdl.org/viewtopic.php?t=11711

The PowerShell script hasn't been tested so this probably won't work on first try.

data.title: Display Freezes Until the Window is Refreshed
data.body:
Once I open the game and try to play it does not have any crashes or faults but the graphical display does not register in realtime, instead it freezes on whatever frame it was opened to until I refresh the window. I can't, rather, I don't want to play the game when I have to keep pressing Alt + Tab to see what my units are doing.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30189429-display-freezes-until-the-window-is-refreshed?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Can not create OpenGL context. (Error: Invalid window)
data.body:
On starting up OpenRA release-20151224., I get a crash message. I've looked at the exception log and it seems to be a problem with graphical errors.

Exception Log:
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: No suitable renderers were found. Check graphics.log for details.
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

Graphical Log:
System.InvalidOperationException: Can not create OpenGL context. (Error: Invalid window)
   at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Sdl2GraphicsDevice..ctor(Size windowSize, WindowMode windowMode)

data.title: Add all remaining d2k speech notifications
data.body:
to `notifications.yaml`.

Excluded are the `MAP*` speech notifications, as they differ between the factions and are used in the mission selector only.

Also arranged everything in alphabetical order.

data.title: ignore wrong template on map
data.body:
Fixes #10593.

I've implemented the changes suggested by @abcdefg30 to TerrainRenderer.cs.

This might be a bit of a brute force approach though?

data.title: Fix a crash in d2k caused by empty bounds
data.body:
~~I'm using `CustomSelectionSize`, because somehow `AutoSelectionSize` didn't work.~~

EDIT: While looking at #10462 I just noticed that we are allowing empty bounds, so I just added respective checks to prevent the crash.

The crash is easy to reproduce: Just launch the d2k mod.

```
System.ArgumentException: bounds must be non-empty.
   at OpenRA.Primitives.SpatiallyPartitioned`1.ValidateBounds(Rectangle bounds) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Primitives\SpatiallyPartitioned.cs:Line 36.
   at OpenRA.Primitives.SpatiallyPartitioned`1.Add(T item, Rectangle bounds) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Primitives\SpatiallyPartitioned.cs:Line 41.
   at OpenRA.Traits.ScreenMap.Add(Actor a) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Traits\World\ScreenMap.cs:Line 77.
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Building.AddedToWorld(Actor self)
   at OpenRA.World.Add(Actor a) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:Line 245.
   at OpenRA.World.CreateActor(Boolean addToWorld, String name, TypeDictionary initDict) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:Line 234.
   at OpenRA.World.CreateActor(String name, TypeDictionary initDict) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:Line 225.
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.SpawnMapActors.WorldLoaded(World world, WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.World.LoadComplete(WorldRenderer wr) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:Line 209.
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, WorldType type) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 161.
   at OpenRA.Game.LoadShellMap() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 443.
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.LoadScreens.BlankLoadScreen.StartGame(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Game.InitializeMod(String mod, Arguments args) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 399.
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 288.
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Line 115.
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Line 33.
```

data.title: Debug frozen actors without footprints
data.body: Intended to provide more information the next time #10460 occurs.

data.title: Ability to save/store your favourite colors
data.body:
A suitable way for the pick-from-boxes crowd, it would be nice if there would be a bunch of empty boxes the player could save their favourite colors to and then instead of going through the UI to reset the shade they want, they would just switch slots.

It's already cumbersome to pick the "perfect" shade so this would probably cheer a bunch of people up in the playerbase.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30164818-ability-to-save-store-your-favourite-colors?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add ReloadAmmo trait and remove Rearm activity
data.body:
This is the first step towards getting rid of `Rearm`/`Repair` activities in favor of upgrade-based solutions for increased flexibility.

Allows actors to be rearmed and repaired at the same time.

This also moves the `RearmBuildings` property from `Aircraft` and `Minelayer` to `ReloadAmmo`.

Supercedes #9606.

data.title: No way to assign a Default AI on Custom Missions
data.body:
I was learning how to create new custom missions when I noticed there is not current way to assign a default AI to an enemy team, by default AI I mean the HackyAI. That would be lovely since not every scenario design needs a coded .lua AI and even useful as a placeholder.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30163747-no-way-to-assign-a-default-ai-on-custom-missions?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Updated to Eluant version 20160124
data.body: See https://github.com/OpenRA/Eluant/pull/2 for changes. Be sure to `make clean` when testing this.

data.title: Cleaned up the GPS code a bit
data.body: Split into separate files and unhardcoded sequences/palettes for lint testing and documentation.

data.title: Game can get stuck in low tech
data.body:
Consider a following scenario:

Players start game with tech level low tech in map which have sea.
One player build an ship yard and transport vessel. Then he move hes MCV to transport vessel, move the vessel away from shore. If that player now leave the game, there is an AI controlled MCV in ship which cannot be destroyed in any mean, because low tech level does not allow anyone to build war ships.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30161630-game-can-stuck-in-low-tech?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Unhardcode the cursors used by RepairsBridges
data.body: Just more unhardcoding and documenting.

data.title: Fixed AI using armed harvesters for combat
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7578. The http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/War_miner is a prime example of this. It shouldn't be used as an active base defense nor to rush an attack as that completely wrecks the bot's economy.

data.title: Added original TS maps Tactical and Terraces
data.body:
Both maps are very open which is good for gameplay. They also don't have bridges.
- http://resource.openra.net/maps/8526/
- http://resource.openra.net/maps/8525/

data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8957.

data.title: Remove bitrotted WeaponInfo.Charges
data.body: There is no logic attached anymore (or never was).
